taskman.backend.simulation

Class SimulationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.simulation.SimulationManager

  • public class SimulationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a simulation.
    Author:
    Jeroen Van Der Donckt, Alexander Braekevelt, Julien Benaouda

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimulationManager()
      Creates a new simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulationManager

        public SimulationManager()

    • Method Detail

      • startSimulation

        public void startSimulation(ProjectOrganizer projectOrganizer,
                            UserManager userManager,
                            ResourceManager resourceManager,
                            Clock clock,
                            User user)
                     throws ImportExportException
        Starts the simulation.
        Parameters:
        projectOrganizer - the project organizer of the system
        userManager - the user manager of the system
        resourceManager - the resource manager of the system
        clock - the clock of the system
        Postcondition:
        the previous state of the simulation is set to an xml string representing the system its state
        Throws:
        ImportExportException - if there occurs an error while creating the xml string
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user is not a project manager

      • cancelSimulation

        public XmlObject cancelSimulation()
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                  ImportExportException
        Cancels the simulation.
        Postcondition:
        the system its state is set back to the previous state of the simulation
        Returns:
        the xml object used to reconstruct the controller
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no previous state in the simulation
        ImportExportException - if there occurs an error while resetting the system to the xml strong

      • executeSimulation

        public void executeSimulation()
        Executes the simulation. The simulation is not revoked.
        Postcondition:
        the previous state of the simulation is set to null
